main event: An unidentified flying object described as red, white and blue and approximately 30 to 40 feet in diameter, was observed visually from Harmon Air Force Base, Newfoundland, on 20 January 1953.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 10 minutes with no apparent trail or exhaust., Instrument readings indicated the light was not steady but flickered at variable rates of speed., Some observers estimated the distance of the object to be between 10 to 25 miles from the base., The object was described as oval-shaped and silent., The local weather indicated good visibility, and some reports suggested the object might have been Venus.
sighted object: unidentified flying object with red, white, and blue colors
witness description: CAPTAIN, USAF, and several officers and enlisted men
